intro: Stenia pastorellii, commonly known as the Pastorelli's stenia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Stenia pastorellii is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats, making it a characteristic species of Mediterranean scrublands.
